content: chore: adaptations for nightly-2024-10-30 #18435\n\nPlease review this PR. At the end of the month this diff will land in master.

@Kyle Miller, this has some changes to #print statements that are presumably consequences of your changes. They look somewhat like regressions to me: more tombstones than there were previously.

Could you take a look and decide if something needs fixing here?
port-progress bot?! You are coming back from the dead :tombstone:

Thanks @Kim Morrison. This change is intentional, to make it possible to know exactly which parameters can be used as named arguments. The before/after-the-colon heuristic wasn't working and was leading to some confusion. The compromise is that dependent binders that are main parameters need to be inaccessible.

I think it's up to metaprograms like @[mk_iff] to give these parameters non-hygienic names.
